newsitem.title: USA: Bridgestone unit, union in tentative pact.
newsitem.headline: Bridgestone unit, union in tentative pact.

text.p: The United Steelworkers of America and Bridgestone Corp.'s Bridgestone/Firestone Inc said Tuesday they tentatively resolved all key issues in a bitter dispute that began in July 1994.

In a joint statement, the Nashville, Tenn.-based company and the union, which is headquartered in Pittsburgh, said they were withholding details of their agreement "pending finalization of specific items and local matters."
Before taking effect, contract settlements reached at the bargaining table generally must be ratified by a vote of the union members covered by the agreements.
Since last year, the USWA has waged a so-called "corporate campaign" against Bridgestone/Firestone, including a boycott against its tires.
In January 1995, the company said it replaced more than 2,000 workers represented by the United Rubber Workers, who went on strike the previous July. The URW merged with the USWA in July 1995.
The URW offered an unconditional return to work in May 1995. Two months ago, the company recalled many of the remaining strikers, leaving fewer than 100 of the replaced strikers out of work.
